msDesc.head: Collection of canon law, liturgical commentary and theology. A-C Germany, 14th century, second half

msItem.note: Fol. i recto blank except for pressmark h 39, top right corner. Fol. i verso blank.
Fol. ii recto blank. Fol. ii verso, 15th-century table of contents for the whole volume, and pressmarks, B.33, E primum, h 39

physDesc.p: Composite: three parts, together by the fifteenth-century binding. The watermark on the endleaves is dreiberg with cross, cf. Piccard vii.2209–2218 (1451–1463)

binding.p: Fifteenth-century quarter-binding of whittawed skin over boards; clasps partly lost. Contents and pressmark on the upper board; contents note on the spine. Stamps of the bindery of St Peter's, Erfurt (w002367), including ape with mirror (s015810), Agnus Dei (?s015822), lion (?s015828), birds on lily (?s015807), eagle (?s015809), lily (s015816), rosette (s015817) rosette (?not in eDB).

history.provenance: St Peter's Erfurt: ex libris, fol. 1r (fifteenth century, second half?); pressmarks, fol. ii verso; binding.
Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow, 1760-?1831, identifiable as 137 in the catalogue of part 3 of his sale, 10 Oct. 1836.
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford, Dec. 2020. Previously described in the Summary Catalogue. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 18 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 19

listBibl.head: Online resources:

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.bibl: Balázs József Nemes, Bibliotheca Cartusiae Erfordiensis : Dokumentation über den überlieferten Buchbestand der Erfurter Kartause, 3., korrigierte und erweiterte Version (2022) DOI: 10.6094/UNIFR/223370

msItem.title: Commentary on Adam of Aldersbach, Summula Raymundi
msItem.incipit: Prodigit ista Non ex subtili sed vili scribimus

Sententia littere est talis quod solum modo vna collecta debet dici in missa sed si alicuius alterius sancti festum fuerit in die eiusdem solempnitatis tunc collecta debet imponi de eodem sancto post collectam solempnis festi. Primo nota quod aliqui dicunt quod iste liber non sit editus per ipsum reimundum
(fol. 2ra) In defunctorum Hic autor prosequitur de alio documento et dicit quod quando tu dicis collectam in missa pro defunctis
[final section] Hic autor ponit aliud documentum in quo autor ostendit quomodo legende et istorie per totum annum debent imponi
msItem.explicit: et ista littera bene patet in compoto manuali et eciam in compoto ecclesiastice ergo hic non est de esse istius libri sed de bene esse etc Finis deo gratias.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks: bull's head with six-pointed star, type Piccard i.849 (1364–1371) ; two stars with two circles (not closely resembling any of the examples, concentrated 1360–1375, in WZIS);
supportDesc.collation: 1(12+1, one leaf added after fol. 12 at the end of the quire) (fols. 1–13), 2(16) (fols. 14–29), 3(18) (fols. 30–47), 4(12) (fols. 48–59), 5(two) (fols. 60–1). Quires numbered in arabic in red on the bottom of the opening recto.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 60–68 lines. Frame-ruled, ruled space 235–240 135–140 with c. 20 mm. between columns.

handDesc.handNote: Lemmata in textualis, some added later.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red initials of c. 12–16 lines sometimes with decorative elements; lacking in places.

msItem.incipit: Seneca in libro epistolarum sic ait uir speculatuius est quasi deus in humano corpore hospitatus
(fol. 62vb) Grates nunc omnes Iste liber posset diuidi in tot partes quot sunt sequentie
msItem.note: See art. 3; breaks off unfinished. Fol. 63vb blank, fol. 64r-v ruled, blank; fol. 65r blank.
Text on the vices and virtues.
msItem.incipit: Superbia habet principales filias 5. Primo inobediencia
msItem.note: Addition, 15th century. Fols. 62–5 are a quire of four leaves, apparently reject leaves of the following work with a later addition.

msItem.title: Sequence commentary 'Vir speculatiuus'
msItem.rubric: Glosa super sequentias et ympnos [later hand]
msItem.incipit: Scribit seneca in epistolis suis Vir speculatiuus est quasi deus in humano
Grates nunc omnes reddamus Iste liber posset dividi in tot partes quot sunt consequencie
msItem.note: Final sequence, fol. 122vb (Sanctissime virginis, AH 55.203):
msItem.incipit: Ista sequentia que de sancta katherina canitur et dividitur in tres. Primo autor hortatur nos
msItem.note: Breaks off unfinished. Fol. 71ra part blank; fol. 71rb blank; fol. 71va part blank; fol. 122vb part blank.
msItem.bibl: E. Kihlman, Expositiones sequentiarum: Medieval sequence commentaries and prologues (2006) section 8.3 edits the introduction and the commentary on 'Ad celebres rex'; pp. 289–90 lists the sequences included in this version.

msItem.note: Misbound (numbered '8 quarternus' but placed after the wrong seventh quire), and should follow fol. 176a, forming the end of the following article.
msItem.incipit: dimitterunt et cum sic iuerunt circumdedit eos nubis et onda ita quod non videbantur
msItem.note: Final hymn (Gaude visceribus)(fol. 123rb):
msItem.rubric: De natiuitate beate Marie [added in margin]
msItem.incipit: Iste ympnus cantatur de natiuitate beate marie virginis et dividitur in duas. Primo alloquitur nativitate marie virginis
msItem.explicit: virga que christum produxit. Sequitur Te nunc suppliciter
msItem.note: Breaks off unfinished.
Fol. 124vb blank.

msItem.title: Expositio hymnorum 'Littera occidit'
msItem.incipit: Littera occidit spiritus autem viuicat viuificat Vnde Aristoteles scribit scribit primo elencorum res sunt multe et quasi in finite nomina pauca
Conditor alme siderum eterna lux Iste liber qui subordinatur theologice philosophice
(fol. 176va, 'O gloriosa domina excelsa') Hic prosequitur clamorose laudans et exultans beatam virginem
msItem.note: Text continues on fol. 123ra.
The opening paragraphs are printed and translated in J. B. Allen, The Ethical Poetic of the Later Middle Ages : A decorum of convenient distinction (1982) 241–2 n. 62.
Also apparently in Mainz SB, Hs I 374, fols. 2ra-75vb; cf. Graz, UB, Ms. 904, bl. 73–92.

Several folios or parts of folios blank: part of fol. 129vb (with later addition); fol. 138r, 138va; fol. 146r-v, 147ra; fol. 147ra; fol. 147v; fol. 148r, 148va; part of fol. 174rb; fol. 174va and part of 174vb. The completeness of the text is unclear and requires further study.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks: circle-star-circle (WZIS) (fols. 62–5); pear with two leaves; bull's head, cf. Piccard i.454 (1363); bull's head, cf. Piccard i.811 (1364); bell; anulus with cross (not in WZIS); one or more indistinct marks.
supportDesc.collation: A(4) (fols. 62–5), 1(8)-6(8) (fols. 66–113), 7(8+1: 1 fol. added at the end of the quire after fol. 121) (fols. 114–122), 8(two, collation uncertain, belongs after fol. 176(a)) (fols. 122–4) | 9(8–3: 6–8 canc. after fol. 129) (fols. 125–129), 10(8)-11(8) (fols. 130–145), 12(8–1, missing 2 after fol. 146) (fols. 146–152), 13(8)-15(8) (fols. 152–176(a) ; quires numbered at the bottom of the opening recto in two sequences, 1–8 and 1–7, the first quire not numbered.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 49–51 lines. Frame-ruled, ruled space 200–5 150–5 with c. 15 mm. between columns. Fols. 62ra-63va, 230 135 with c. 20 mm. between columns.

handDesc.handNote: Cursiva antiquior by one hand except for fols. 62ra-63va and additions (e.g. fol. 129vb).

decoDesc.decoNote: Red initials (c. 6–8 lines) with flourishing in black ink, fols. 66r, 125r, 126r, etc.
Lemmata missing for much of the texts.

msItem.title: Quaestiones in quartum librum Sententiarum
msItem.incipit: Consequenter queritur. Circa 4m sentenciarum queritur primo vtrum tota theologia traxerit suam totam origenem a deo et videtur primo quod non
(fol. 224ra, final quaestio) Consequenter queritur utrum indulgencie date in ista vita possint subuenire animabus in purgatorio
msItem.explicit: possit eis dari indulgencia ex predictis
msItem.finalRubric:
Expliciunt qestiones preamande super quartum sententiarum xlvj in toto
quartum sententiarum disputate a fratre minore lectore in erfordie [repeated]
msItem.note: Fol. 226rb ruled, blank, with signs of wear, so fols. 172(b)-226 perhaps circulated independently, although the paper and probably script are uniform with fols. 227–239.
Followed by a series of short notes: 'Omnibus adde modum ...', 'Pater noster qui es in celis ...', etc.

msItem.title: Expositio canonis missae 'Videte quomodo'
msItem.note: (Zumkeller 645, 875)
msItem.incipit: Videte quomodo caute ambuletis Ista propositio scribitur ad eyffesios quinto capitulo. Dyonisius super ecclesiastica gerarchia particula prima capitulo 3º dicit error contra eukaristiam
Te igitur clementissime pater Secundum Hugonem in libro de sacramentis canon iste
msItem.explicit: nos perducat ille cuius corpus est in canone consecratum cuius nomen est in secula benedictum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit canon amen scriptori posco solamen [repeated]
msItem.note: Fol. 239rb blank, fol. 239v ruled, blank except for note at top 'assit ad inceptum sancta maria meum'.

supportDesc.support: paper, folded in quarto. Watermark: circle with cross (WZIS)
supportDesc.collation: 1(8)-6(8) (fols. 176(b)-215), 7(12–1, 12 canc.) (fols. 216–26) | 8(8) (fols. 227–34), 9(6–1, 6 canc. (?)) (fols. 235–9). Leaf numbering in arabic in red sometimes visible. Quires 1–5 numbered in arabic on the bottom of the opening recto.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 58–59 lines. Frame-ruled, ruled space 240–5 160–5 with c. 12 mm. between columns.

handDesc.handNote: Cursiva antiquior mostly by one hand (cf. fol. 191va-b)

decoDesc.decoNote: Coloured red, red-and-black initials (c. 4 lines) sometimes with simple decoration.

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Hamilton 17 - upper and lower pastedowns

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: Parts of the Office for the Dead (upper pastedown, top leaf; lower pastedown, bottom leaf) and the Common of the Virgins (upper pastedown, lower leaf; lower pastedown, upper leaf). From the same manuscript as MS. Hamilton 12, fol. 169. The upper pastedown also has a fifteenth-century note of the contents of the volume. Fragments of the same manuscript are used for quire strengtheners.

layoutDesc.layout: One col. of at least 17 lines. Current size of the fragment 295 200 size of the leaf at least 200 150
